responses.description: Carry on your way!

demo.description: Congratulations. You've just been awarded $500 for your use of string_val in the workplace.

responses.description: Graciously accept the gift.

demo.description: Some local investors are growing wary with your use of string_val in the workplace, even going so far as to request your discontinuing of it.

responses.description: Stop your use at once, no matter the immediate financial cost.
Continue as you were. This is integral to how your company operates, and the investors should see that.

demo.description: Licensing fees. You have to pay to continue using string_val for your company.

responses.description: Pay the fees.
Don't pay the fees.

demo.description: The SEC recently investigated and shut down your rival company for money laundering in the Caymen Islands. Now some of their top employees are looking for new work.

responses.description: Hire those brainy criminals
Don't hire them; your current team is great as is.

investor.description: Well known and highly respected investor John Smith publicly endorses your product and wants to purchase stock in your company.

responses.description: Accept his offer and allow him to invest.
Politely decline his offer. While generous, you already have enough funding
Aggressively reject his offer. Release a public statement denouncing John Smith, claiming that his success was only due to luck and that his morals are corrupt.

investor.description: Former convicted felon turned millionaire Bane Crobber wants to invest in your company. He's a controversial figure, so support from him may hurt reputation.

responses.description: Money is money. Who cares what people think? Allow him to invest.
Moral integrity and public perception are important. Reject his offer.

government.description: The government has passed a new regulation: a fine regarding string_val, to be paid immediately. It's gonna cost you $500

responses.description: Pay the fine
Don't pay the fine. What's the worst the government could do, sue you?

government.description: It's everyone's favorite: Tax Day! Looks like you'll be paying a sum of $5000, unfortunately

responses.description: Pay them what you owe
Don't pay your taxes
Fudge the numbers a bit. They won't notice you kept $2500, right? Just say it went to charity

employee.description: Following the escape at the local zoo, the cougars, lions and tigers have roamed into the office. And they look hungry.

responses.description: Take them out. Doing so may spark another Harambe-esque internet outrage and hurt your reputation, but employee safety is important
Run for your life. Let your employees figure it out. They're supposed to be quick on their feet, aren't they?
Calmly try to pet them. Cats are supposed to be friendly after all, right?

other.description: A massive tsunami wave hit your city and flooded the first floor of the office building. Repairs could be costly.

responses.description: Call in a contractor to drain the water and fix the damages. It will be expensive, but a functional workspace is essential.
Seems like an unnecessary expense. Force your employees to wear rain boots and work through it.

employee.description: emp_name has submitted an application to your team. A recent computer science grad from Cornell University's College of Engineering, it seems they would make a fine addition to your company.

responses.description: Accept the application.
Reject the application.
